text.name: sys_description
text.text: The PS2, 128-bit Sony console released in 2000, is the best-selling in the history of video games. A Slim version released at the end of 2004. Equipped with the Emotion Engine processor clocked at 150 Mhz, supported by two other sub-processors, 32 Mb of RAM, 4 Mb of video RAM, a hard drive and an internet connection, it can Calculate 16 million polygons per second. It displays 480p 16/9 in 720 × 480 and 4/3 in 640 × 480 pixels. DTS-ES digital sound output. It presents a catalog of more than 10,035 games and flagship franchises like God of War, Ratchet & Clank and Jak’n Daxter.
